@set.title: Twelve unresolved questions on Scottish independence
@set.description: The debate surrounding how Scotland would go forward if its people voted for independence has thrown up a number of unanswered questions, which BBC reporter Andrew Black details here.

@set.title: What would happen to Scotland's economy after independence?
@set.description: Could Scotland afford to go it alone, and would it want to, asks Douglas Fraser, BBC Scotland's business and economy editor.

@set.title: UK 'will not block' Scottish independence referendum
@set.description: The UK government will not move to block a referendum on independence for Scotland, Scottish Secretary Michael Moore says.

@set.title: Scottish independence: MSPs to pass Scots referendum bill
@set.description: Legislation to hold the Scottish independence referendum is expected to pass its final parliamentary stage at Holyrood later.

@set.title: Scottish independence: What would it mean for the rest of the UK?
@set.description: In September next year voters in Scotland will go to the polls. But how would an independent Scotland impact on the rest of the UK?

@set.title: Scotland's referendum: Ten things we learned in 2013
@set.description: The independence debate began to gather pace this year. Here's a light-hearted look back at 10 things we discovered over the past 12 months.

@graph.preferredLabel: SNP launches drive for Scottish independence

@set.title: Salmond responds to Leveson report
@set.description: First Minister Alex Salmond tells MSPs he wants to set up an independent implementation group following Lord Leveson's report.

@set.title: Salmond sets out referendum question
@set.description: Stephen Walker reflects on Alex Salmond's proposals for a referendum on independence from the rest of the UK.

@set.title: Salmond calls for independence referendum in 2014
@set.description: The Scottish government plans to hold an independence referendum in the autumn of 2014, First Minister Alex Salmond says.

@set.title: SNP independence campaign 'starts today', conference told
@set.description: The SNP officially launches its drive for independence, announcing details of an "unprecedented" campaign to win the forthcoming referendum.

@set.title: SNP treads 'road to independence'
@set.description: A look at the SNP's strategy for winning Scottish independence

@set.title: Exclusive: Alex Salmond 'hid legal reality of an independent Scotlandâs EU status'
@set.description: Alex Salmond is facing accusations of hiding the full legal reality behind the Scottish Governments assurances that an independent Scotland would enjoy fast-tracked membership of the EU.

@set.title: Scottish independence: Darling launches Better Together campaign
@set.description: Former chancellor Alistair Darling is launching the campaign to keep the union, warning that if Scotland leaves Britain, there is "no way back".

@set.title: Scotland's 'Yes' campaign begins
@set.description: A campaign to persuade people in Scotland to vote for independence begins on Friday. The group is calling on voters to put "Scotland's future in Scotland's hands".

@graph.preferredLabel: Discussion around issues of a potentially independent Scotland

@set.title: Scottish independence: Experts say a 'yes vote' Scotland would need new powers
@set.description: Legal experts suggest that Scotland would not continue to hold the same rights and powers in the event of a yes vote in the 2014 referendum.

@set.title: Scotland could refuse to accept UK liabilities if currency union is blocked
@set.description: Scottish deputy first minister Nicola Sturgeon issues warning before launch of her government's white paper on independence. An independent Scotland may refuse to accept its share of the United Kingdom's liabilities if London refuses to allow Edinburgh to form a sterling currency union with the remainder of the UK, the deputy first minister of the Scottish government has warned. . Hours before the launch of the Scottish government's 670-page white paper on independence, Nicola Sturgeon said a...

@set.title: No currency union with independent Scotland, George Osborne confirms
@set.description: Chancellor tells audience in Edinburgh that currency union between Scotland and rest of UK would be unworkable. . George Osborne has officially vetoed proposals for a currency union with an independent Scotland, in an attempt to deal a hammer blow to Alex Salmond's independence campaign. The chancellor told an audience in Edinburgh that a currency union between Scotland and the rest of the UK would be unworkable and cause great damage to both the UK and Scottish economies. "People need to kno...

@set.title: Scottish independence EU bid 'extremely difficult' says Jose Manuel Barroso
@set.description: It would be "extremely difficult, if not impossible" for an independent Scotland to get the necessary approval from the member states for it to join the European Union (EU), the president of the European Commission has said.

@set.title: CBI questions independence plans
@set.description: The Scottish Government blueprint for independence "does not add up", with Nationalists ignoring the need for deficit reduction while promising at least 670 million of "unfunded" spending commitments, a business leader claimed.

@set.title: Independent Scotland 'might not need a full security agency'
@set.description: A report claims Scotland could be better served by co-operating with current intelligence services.

@set.title: Scottish independence: Yes vote could mean UK credit rating review, says Fitch
@set.description: A vote for Scottish independence would delay the UK's return to triple A credit status, according to the ratings agency, Fitch.

@set.title: Scottish Independence: Scotland would become independent on March 24 2016, government white paper says
@set.description: Scotland could become an independent country on March 24 2016 if voters back leaving the UK in next year's  independence  referendum, the Deputy First Minister has announced. .

@set.title: Scotland Independence: SNP Unveils White Paper
@set.description: A 670-page "independence encyclopaedia" promises to provide all the detail on how a breakaway Scotland would work.

@set.title: Scottish independence: Alex Salmond unveils white paper
@set.description: First Minister Alex Salmond says "Scotland's future is in Scotland's hands" as he outlines the Scottish government's case for independence.

@set.title: Scottish independence: Cameron and Salmond sign referendum deal
@set.description: A deal setting out terms for a Scottish independence referendum has been signed by Prime Minister David Cameron and First Minister Alex Salmond.

@set.title: Cameron denies 'dictating' terms of Scottish referendum
@set.description: David Cameron denies trying to "dictate" the terms of a Scottish referendum - as Scotland's Deputy First Minister accuses him of trying to interfere.

@set.title: Scottish independence: Referendum agreement at-a-glance
@set.description: A deal setting out terms for a Scottish independence referendum is signed by Prime Minister David Cameron and First Minister Alex Salmond. Here is a summary of the agreement.
